content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.
  1. Select three expressions that are perfect squares.
  • \((x+5)(x+5)\)
  • \((-9+c)(c-9)\)
  • \((y-10)(10-y)\)
  • \((2x-1)(2x+1)\)
  • \((4-3x)(3-4x)\)
  • \((a+b)(b+a)\)

Answer: \((x+5)(x+5)\), \((-9+c)(c-9)\), \((a+b)(b+a)\)

  1. Each diagram represents the square of an expression or a perfect square. Complete the cells in the last table by answering questions a–d.

Diagram 1

Diagram 2

Diagram 3

  1. What is the answer for Cell a in Diagram 3?
  • \(\frac {1}{3}h\)
  • \(h^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3}h)^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3})^2\)

Answer: \(h^2\)

  1. What is the answer for Cell b in Diagram 3?
  • \(\frac {1}{3}h\)
  • \(h^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3}h)^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3})^2\)

Answer: \(\frac {1}{3}h\)

  1. What is the answer for Cell c in Diagram 3?
  • \(\frac {1}{3}h\)
  • \(h^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3}h)^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3})^2\)

Answer: \(\frac {1}{3}h\)

  1. What is the answer for Cell d in Diagram 3?
  • \(\frac {1}{3}h\)
  • \(h^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3}h)^2\)
  • \((\frac {1}{3})^2\)
  1. Rewrite the perfect-square expression \((n+7)^2\) in standard form \(ax^2+bx+c\).
  • \(16n+49\)
  • \(n^2+14n+14\)
  • \(n^2+49n+14\)
  • \(n^2+14n+49\)

Answer: \(n^2+14n+49\)

  1. Rewrite the perfect-square expression \((5-m)^2\) in standard form \(ax^2+bx+c\).
  • \(-12m+10\)
  • \(m^2+10m-25\)
  • \( m^2-10m+25\)
  • \(25m^2-10\)

Answer: \( m^2-10m+25\)

  1. Rewrite the perfect-square expression \((h+ \frac {1}{3})^2\) in standard form \(ax^2+bx+c\).
  • \(2h+\frac {2}{3}h+\frac {1}{9}\)
  • \(h^2+\frac {2}{3}h+\frac {1}{9}\)
  • \(h^2+\frac {2}{6}h+\frac {2}{6}\)
  • \(h^2+\frac {1}{9}h+\frac {2}{3}\)

Answer: \(h^2+\frac {2}{3}h+\frac {1}{9}\)

For questions 6-9, solve each equation, then choose the two solutions.

  1. \((x-1)^2=4\)
  • \(x = -1\)
  • \(x = 5\)
  • \(x = 2\)
  • \(x = 3\)
  • \(x = 6\)

Answer: \(x = -1\), \(x = 3\)

  1. \((x+5)^2=81\)
  • \( x = 76\)
  • \(x = -14\)
  • \(x = 86\)
  • \(x = 3\)
  • \(x = 4\)

Answer: \(x = -14\), \(x = 4\)

  1. \((x+11)^2=121\)
  • \(x = 132\)
  • \(x = 110\)
  • \(x = 0\)
  • \(x = -22\)
  • \(x = 4\)

Answer: \(x = 0\), \(x = -22\)

  1. \((x-7)^2=\frac {64}{49}\)
  • \(x = 2\)
  • \(x=- \frac {279}{79}\)
  • \(x= \frac {41}{7}\)
  • \(x= \frac {407}{49}\)
  • \(x = \frac {57}{7}\)

Answer: \(x= \frac {41}{7}\), \(x = \frac {57}{7}\)

  1. Solve the equation \((x-2)^2=0\).

Answer: \(x=2\)
